result.execSummary:
The defendant Young J. Chang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA surcharge and submit a DNA sample.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

On home monitor if he qualifies. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Young J. Chang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Young J. Chang in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:07 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files Amended Information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Believes the defense will be asking for expungment.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Makes statements re: City citations and agreement with the city attorney. 
City attorney, Beveridge, is present in the courtroom. 
Court questions Atty Beveridge. 
Atty Beveridge agrees with the agreement as stated. 
Court notes amended information indicates Count 2. 
Parties do not object to the change on the Amended Information. 
Court corrects to Count 1. 
Atty Schmidt received a copy of the Amended Information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  Opposes expungment request by defense. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Serve 10 days jail on home monitor if he qualifies. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA surcharge and submit a DNA sample.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Young J. Chang in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:10 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Young J. Chang in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Young J. Chang in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:16 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Knaapen indicates he spoke with the defendant briefly before court and has informed him he is trying to obtain counsel. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant makes statements re: trouble contacting an attorney during the day. 
Court advises defendant of right to have this hearing held within 30 days.  Questions if he is willing to waive that right. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing time limits. 
Atty Knaapen accepts.  Requests to set for an adjourned initial appearance so that an attorney can be obtained and a date set when counsel is present. 
Defendant believes he can have an attorney by then. 
Court clarifies the reason for the adjourned initial for the defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Young J. Chang in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:42 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Defendant tried getting a public defender but did not qualify.
Court did review the petition and was found that Defendant did not qualify.
Defendant cannot afford an attorney.

Bond was previously set.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Young J. Chang in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
9:07 a.m. case is called.
Address is verified.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

**Defendant would like to consult with an attorney

Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 

Matter is continued 

Bond is continued.
9:09 a.m. case is concluded.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: $500 cash bond: Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License

1:16 p.m.
DA Case #15PT1203
d.o.b. 06-14-95
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Fleeing an Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.  
BTC: $500 cash bond: Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License 
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  07-06-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch   1
